title: Google\Cloud\BigQuery\QueryResults
name: QueryResults
description:
QueryResults represent the result of a BigQuery SQL query. Read more at the Query Response API Documentation.

This class should be not instantiated directly, but as a result of calling Google\Cloud\BigQuery\BigQueryClient::runQuery() or Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Job::queryResults().

params.name: connection
params.description: Represents a connection to BigQuery.

params.name: jobId
params.description: The job's ID.

params.name: projectId
params.description: The project's ID.

params.name: info
params.description: The query result's metadata.

params.name: mapper
params.description: Maps values between PHP and BigQuery.

params.name: job
params.description: The job from which the query results originated.

params.name: queryResultsOptions
params.description: Default options to be used for calls to get query results.

methods.name: rows
methods.description:
Retrieves the rows associated with the query and merges them together with the table's schema.

Refer to the table below for a guide on how BigQuery types are mapped as they come back from the API.

PHP Type BigQuery Data Type
\DateTimeInterface DATETIME
Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Bytes BYTES
Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Date DATE
Google\Cloud\Core\Int64 INTEGER
Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Time TIME
Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Timestamp TIMESTAMP
Associative Array RECORD
Non-Associative Array RECORD (Repeated)
float FLOAT
int INTEGER
string STRING
bool BOOLEAN

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options. Please note, these options will inherit the values set by either Google\Cloud\BigQuery\BigQueryClient::runQuery() or Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Job::queryResults().

params.name: options.maxResults
params.description: Maximum number of results to read per page.

params.name: options.startIndex
params.description: Zero-based index of the starting row.

params.name: options.timeoutMs
params.description: How long, in milliseconds, each API call will wait for query results to become available before timing out. Depending on whether the $maxRetries has been exceeded, the results will be polled again after the timeout has been reached. Defaults to 10000 milliseconds (10 seconds).

params.name: options.maxRetries
params.description: The number of times to poll the Job status, until the job is complete. By default, will poll indefinitely.

params.name: options.returnRawResults
params.description: Returns the raw data types returned from BigQuery without converting their values into native PHP types or the custom type classes supported by this library.

exceptions.description:
If the maximum number of retries while waiting for
        query completion has been exceeded.
Thrown in the case of a malformed response.

methods.name: reload
methods.description: Triggers a network request to reload the query's details.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.maxResults
params.description: Maximum number of results to read per page.

params.name: options.startIndex
params.description: Zero-based index of the starting row.

params.name: options.timeoutMs
params.description: How long to wait for the query to complete, in milliseconds. Defaults to 10000 milliseconds (10 seconds).

methods.name: identity
methods.description:
Retrieves the query result's identity.

An identity provides a description of a nested resource.

methods.name: isComplete
methods.description: Checks the job's completeness. Useful in combination with Google\Cloud\BigQuery\QueryResults::reload() to poll for query status.

methods.name: job
methods.description: Returns a reference to the Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Job instance used to fetch the query results. This is especially useful when attempting to access job statistics after calling Google\Cloud\BigQuery\BigQueryClient::runQuery().
